2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w		Setting up initscripts (2.86.ds1-6ubuntu32) ...
2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w		mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on varrun,
2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w		       missing codepage or other error
2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w		       In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w		       dmesg | tail  or so
2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w		dpkg: error processing initscripts (--configure):
2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w		 subprocess post-installation script returned error exit status 32
2006-07-15T05:22:00.000Z	h6w
if you want any sympathetic response, that is.
it says, use http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org if you've got errors to paste.
are you mounting something to /varrun in /etc/fstab?
strange... post your /etc/fstab on the same site pls
that looks okay, doesn't explain your problem... xfs as root should be okay, although it's unusual... Can't really tell you what's going on. Is a re-install out of the question?
just backup your /etc/ndiswrapper, or your entire /etc if you prefer
